name: hungryhouse.co.uk
overview:
hungryhouse.co.uk is an online takeaway portal that allows users to search for local takeaway restaurants, view menus and place orders for their food online, putting an end to the need to phone up and place on order.

The site was launched in Febuary 2006, by Managing Director Shane Lake and Operations Manager Tony Charles, who were later joined by Marketing Manager Graeme Horne.

The founders of the site had a successful appearance on BBCâ€™s â€˜Dragonsâ€™ Denâ€™ when business tycoons James Caan and Duncan Bannatyne shook hands on a Â£100,000 deal with hungryhouse.co.uk, having been impressed with the pitch, demonstrating the benefits of ordering takeaway food via the internet.

Although the founders decided to work with a different investor following their appearance on the programme, hungryhouse.co.uk now has around 2,500 restaurant partnerships on the site, which currently facilitates more than Â£200,000 worth of takeaway orders every week and gives users access to more than 125,000 customer ratings.
